question: On þissum dagum #### micel þegen ferde eft to Englalande⁠ — On this day the mighty thane went again to England
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'se' because it is tied to the subject 'þegen'

question: Se biscop grete #### cyning — The abbot greets the king
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þone' because it is tied to 'cyning' which is directly receiving the action of the verb 'grete'

question: In #### cyninges tune — In the town of the king
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæs' because it is tied to 'cyning' which has the genitive singular 'es' ending

question: Se cyning ferþ to #### tune — The king goes to the town
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæm' because it is tied to 'tun' which has the dative singular 'e' ending

question: #### biscopas geaf þone stan to þaem þegne — The bishops gave the stone to the thane
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þa' because it is tied to the subject 'biscop' which has the plural 'as' ending

question: Se cyning ond seo cwen gretaþ #### biscopas — The king and the queen greet the bishops
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þa' because it is tied to 'biscop' which has the plural 'as' ending and is the direct recipient of the verb 'grete'

question: #### wicingas woldon þæt þa Deniscan þegnas ricsoden ofer Englalande - The Vikings wished that the Danish thanes ruled over England
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þara' because it is tied to 'wicing' which has the genetive plural ending 'a'

question: Se geaf þa garas to #### þegnum — He gave the spear to the thanes
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæm' because it is tied to 'þegnum' which has the dative plural 'um' ending

question: #### biscop wæs halig and eaþmod⁠ — The bishop was holy and humble
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'se' because it is tied to the subject 'biscop'

question: Se þegen sloh #### biscop in þæm tune þe wæs genemed Stanford — The thane slew the bishop in the town called Stamford
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þone' because it is tied to 'biscop' which is directly receiving the action of the verb 'sloh'

question: Ða bearn #### cyninges beoþ wise and eaþmode - The children of the king are wise and humble
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæs' because it is tied to 'cyning' which has the genitive singular 'es' ending

question: On þissum geare sende he þone ealdan biscop Wulfstan to #### stede þe wæs genemened Readingum - On this year he sent the old Bishop Wulfstan to the place that was called Reading
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæm' because it is tied to 'stede'. While 'stede' already ends in an e, making it hard to tell the case, it is after the preposition 'to' and indirectly receiving the action which makes it dative

question: #### biscopas comon fram þæm tunum Londenum ond Readingum genemned — The bishops came from the towns called London and Reading
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þa' because it is tied to the subject 'biscop' which has the plural 'as' ending

question: Gaþ! Fliemaþ #### Englas ond timbriaþ fela tuna on hiera landum⁠ — Go! Banish the English and build many towns on their land
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þa' because it is tied to 'Englas' which has the plural 'as' ending and is the direct recipient of the verb 'fliemaþ'

question: Eall #### biscopa preostas ferdon to þæm haligum stede mid him — All the bishops’ priests went to the holy place with them
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þara' because it is tied to 'biscopa' which has the genetive plural ending 'a'

question: He cwæð þæt he bude on #### landum norþweardum wiþ þa Westsæ⁠ — He said that he lived in the lands northward along the west sea
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæm' because it is tied to 'land' which has the dative plural 'um' ending

question: Giet wæs #### cyning Aelfred geong⁠ — Still, the king Alfred was young
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'se' because it is tied to the subject 'cyning'

question: Ælfric geaf #### æþelinge drync - Aelfric gave the prince a drink
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þone' because it is tied to 'æþeling' which is directly receiving the action of the verb 'geaf'

question: He geaf #### æþelinges begas to þære cwene - He gave the prince's rings to the queen
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæs' because it is tied to 'æþeling' which has the genitive singular 'es' ending

question: Se abbot com fram #### beorgum⁠ — The abbot came from the mountains
explanation: Here the demonstrative pronoun is 'þæm' because it is tied to 'beorg' which has the dative plural 'um' ending
